intro: Erigeron linosyris, commonly known as the narrowleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Erigeron linosyris is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid conditions.
